verses.kjv: Thus hath the Lord GOD shewed unto me; and, behold, he formed grasshoppers in the beginning of the shooting up of the latter growth; and, lo, it was the latter growth after the king’s mowings.
verses.web: Thus the Lord LORD showed me: and behold, he formed locusts in the beginning of the shooting up of the latter growth; and behold, it was the latter growth after the king’s harvest.
verses.ct: This is what the Lord GOD showed me: He was forming a swarm of locusts just as the late crops were beginning to sprout — the crops that grew after the king's share had already been harvested.

verses.kjv: And it came to pass, that when they had made an end of eating the grass of the land, then I said, O Lord GOD, forgive, I beseech thee: by whom shall Jacob arise? for he is small.
verses.web: When they finished eating the grass of the land, then I said, “Lord LORD, forgive, I beg you! How could Jacob stand? For he is small.”
verses.ct: When the locusts had devoured every green thing in the land, I cried out, "Lord GOD, please forgive! How can Jacob survive? He's so small!"

verses.kjv: The LORD repented for this: It shall not be, saith the LORD.
verses.web: LORD relented concerning this. “It shall not be,” says LORD.
verses.ct: The LORD relented. "It won't happen," the LORD said.

verses.kjv: Thus hath the Lord GOD shewed unto me: and, behold, the Lord GOD called to contend by fire, and it devoured the great deep, and did eat up a part.
verses.web: Thus the Lord LORD showed me and behold, the Lord LORD called for judgment by fire; and it dried up the great deep, and would have devoured the land.
verses.ct: Then the Lord GOD showed me another vision: The Lord GOD was calling down a judgment of fire. It dried up the great deep and was devouring the land.

verses.kjv: Then said I, O Lord GOD, cease, I beseech thee: by whom shall Jacob arise? for he is small.
verses.web: Then I said, “Lord LORD, stop, I beg you! How could Jacob stand? For he is small.”
verses.ct: I cried out, "Lord GOD, please stop! How can Jacob survive? He's so small!"

verses.kjv: The LORD repented for this: This also shall not be, saith the Lord GOD.
verses.web: LORD relented concerning this. “This also shall not be,” says the Lord LORD.
verses.ct: The LORD relented again. "This won't happen either," said the Lord GOD.

verses.kjv: Thus he shewed me: and, behold, the LORD stood upon a wall made by a plumbline, with a plumbline in his hand.
verses.web: Thus he showed me and behold, the Lord stood beside a wall made by a plumb line, with a plumb line in his hand.
verses.ct: Then he showed me another vision: The LORD was standing beside a wall that had been built straight with a plumb line, and he held a plumb line in his hand.

verses.kjv: And the LORD said unto me, Amos, what seest thou? And I said, A plumbline. Then said the LORD, Behold, I will set a plumbline in the midst of my people Israel: I will not again pass by them any more:
verses.web: LORD said to me, “Amos, what do you see?” I said, “A plumb line.” Then the Lord said, “Behold, I will set a plumb line in the middle of my people Israel. I will not again pass by them any more.
verses.ct: The LORD asked me, "Amos, what do you see?" I answered, "A plumb line." Then the LORD said, "I am setting a plumb line among my people Israel to measure them. I will not spare them any longer.

verses.kjv: And the high places of Isaac shall be desolate, and the sanctuaries of Israel shall be laid waste; and I will rise against the house of Jeroboam with the sword.
verses.web: The high places of Isaac will be desolate, the sanctuaries of Israel will be laid waste; and I will rise against the house of Jeroboam with the sword.”
verses.ct: The hilltop shrines of Isaac will be destroyed, and the sanctuaries of Israel will be reduced to rubble. I will rise against the dynasty of Jeroboam with the sword."

verses.kjv: Then Amaziah the priest of Bethel sent to Jeroboam king of Israel, saying, Amos hath conspired against thee in the midst of the house of Israel: the land is not able to bear all his words.
verses.web: Then Amaziah the priest of Bethel sent to Jeroboam king of Israel, saying, “Amos has conspired against you in the middle of the house of Israel. The land is not able to bear all his words.
verses.ct: Amaziah, the priest at Bethel, sent a message to King Jeroboam of Israel: "Amos is plotting against you right here in the heart of Israel. The country can't endure everything he's saying.

verses.kjv: For thus Amos saith, Jeroboam shall die by the sword, and Israel shall surely be led away captive out of their own land.
verses.web: For Amos says, ‘Jeroboam will die by the sword, and Israel shall surely be led away captive out of his land.’ ”
verses.ct: He's claiming, 'Jeroboam will die by the sword, and Israel will be dragged away from its land into exile.'"

verses.kjv: Also Amaziah said unto Amos, O thou seer, go, flee thee away into the land of Judah, and there eat bread, and prophesy there:
verses.web: Amaziah also said to Amos, “You seer, go, flee away into the land of Judah, and there eat bread, and prophesy there:
verses.ct: Then Amaziah confronted Amos directly: "Get out of here, you seer! Run back to the land of Judah. Earn your bread there and do your prophesying there.

verses.kjv: But prophesy not again any more at Bethel: for it is the king’s chapel, and it is the king’s court.
verses.web: but don’t prophesy again any more at Bethel; for it is the king’s sanctuary, and it is a royal house!”
verses.ct: But don't prophesy here at Bethel anymore. This is the king's sanctuary — his royal place of worship!"

verses.kjv: Then answered Amos, and said to Amaziah, I was no prophet, neither was I a prophet’s son; but I was an herdman, and a gatherer of sycomore fruit:
verses.web: Then Amos answered Amaziah, “I was no prophet, neither was I a prophet’s son; but I was a herdsman, and a farmer of sycamore figs;
verses.ct: Amos answered Amaziah, "I was never a prophet, and I wasn't trained as one. I was a herder and a gatherer of sycamore figs.

verses.kjv: And the LORD took me as I followed the flock, and the LORD said unto me, Go, prophesy unto my people Israel.
verses.web: and LORD took me from following the flock, and LORD said to me, ‘Go, prophesy to my people Israel.’
verses.ct: But the LORD took me away from tending the flock and said to me, 'Go, prophesy to my people Israel.'

verses.kjv: Now therefore hear thou the word of the LORD: Thou sayest, Prophesy not against Israel, and drop not thy word against the house of Isaac.
verses.web: Now therefore listen to LORD’s word: ‘You say, Don’t prophesy against Israel, and don’t preach against the house of Isaac.’
verses.ct: So now hear the word of the LORD. You tell me, 'Don't prophesy against Israel, and stop preaching against the house of Isaac.'

verses.kjv: Therefore thus saith the LORD; Thy wife shall be an harlot in the city, and thy sons and thy daughters shall fall by the sword, and thy land shall be divided by line; and thou shalt die in a polluted land: and Israel shall surely go into captivity forth of his land.
verses.web: Therefore LORD says: ‘Your wife shall be a prostitute in the city, and your sons and your daughters shall fall by the sword, and your land shall be divided by line; and you yourself shall die in a land that is unclean, and Israel shall surely be led away captive out of his land.’ ”
verses.ct: Because of that, this is what the LORD says: Your wife will become a prostitute in the city. Your sons and daughters will be killed by the sword. Your land will be measured out and divided among strangers. You yourself will die in a foreign, unclean land. And Israel will certainly be taken from its land into exile."
